abstract: Former Episcopal Bishop Heather Cook accepts plea deal for vehicular manslaughter; while intoxicated she hit cyclist Tom Palermo and fled scene of Baltimore accident; state of Maryland will ask judge for 10-year prison sentence; church revoked clergy credentials.
lead_paragraph: A former Episcopal bishop pleaded guilty Tuesday to manslaughter, drunken driving and leaving the scene in the death of a cyclist in Baltimore.

headline.main: Maryland: Ex-Bishop Enters Plea Deal in Death
headline.print_headline: Maryland: Ex-Bishop Enters Plea Deal in Death

snippet: A former Episcopal bishop pleaded guilty Tuesday to manslaughter, drunken driving and leaving the scene in the death of a cyclist in Baltimore.
